N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 224.1 - Nitric acid production

State Regulations
(a) Existing
emission sources. No person will cause or allow emissions of nitrogen oxides
(expressed as nitrogen dioxide) to the outdoor atmosphere from any existing
emission source used in nitric acid production in excess of the amount
permitted by Part 212 of this Title. An existing emission source is one for
which an application for a permit to construct was received prior to August 18, 1971. (b) New emission sources and
modifications. No person will cause or allow emissions of nitrogen oxides
(expressed as nitrogen dioxide) to the outdoor atmosphere from any emission
source or modification used in nitric acid production, for which an application
for a permit to construct is received after August 17, 1971, in excess of 3.0
pounds per ton of nitric acid produced (expressed as 100 percent nitric
acid). Notes
